metadata.title: Schedule of Measures for Young Adult Participants Measure Day 0 Baseline Days 0-7 Observe Days 8-17 Daily text messages Day 18 Structured goal setting Days 18-28 Daily text messages Self-Report

body_text.text: In the past 28 days, on average, how many hours are 30 minutes or less you outside per day between 10 AM and 4 PM on 31 minutes to 1 hour WEEKDAYS (Monday-Friday)? Select one answer.
More than 1 hour and up to 2 hours More than 2 hours and up to 3 hours More than 3 hours and up to 4 hours More than 4 hours and up to 5 hours More than 5 hours

FIGREF0.text: For the following questions, think about what you would normally do when you are outside on a CLOUDY summer day. Select one answer for each item.

TABREF1.text: What is the number of the sun protection factor (SPF) I do know: SPF 1-10 of the sunscreen that you usually use?

TABREF3.text: Please select the range of times that you did outdoor activities and the types of activities.Please select ALL that apply.Please select the range of times of day that you wore sunglasses/gloves.What were you wearing when you first left the house today?Please select the options below that best match what you were wearing Please select the range of times that you sweat or got wet Stop! Clothing times not in order! First time was later than second time Please select the clothing you were wearing when you added or removed clothing for the first time Stop! Clothing times not in order! Second time was later than third time Stop! Clothing times not in order! Third time was in the "PM" Which part (s) of your body did you apply your third type of sunscreen to? (select all that apply) How will you meet your goal to engage in sun-protected outdoor activity? (Select up to TWO) Tomorrow, I will Apply sunscreen to all of the areas of my body that may be exposed to the sun Apply sunscreen before I go outdoors Wear a hat when I am outdoors Wear a shirt that covers my shoulders when I am outdoors Plan my outdoor activities to avoid being outside from 10 AM to 2 PM Pay attention to the strength of the sun by checking the UV Guard report 15 minutes after I go outside Be careful not to exceed the amount of UV my skin can tolerate

TABREF4.text: Compared to last summer, do you feel that you spent Yes, a lot LESS time outdoors this summer? Yes, a little About the same No, a little more No, a lot more Why do you think the time you spent outdoors this summer was different from last year? (select as many as apply) Were there instances where you went outside while Yes, often wearing the UV sensor without your phone nearby Yes, sometimes (within 2 feet)? No How did you feel about wearing the UV sensor? Liked Neither liked nor disliked Disliked Were there any days that you did not to wear the UV? Yes, often Yes, sometimes No, I wore it every day Why did you choose not to wear the UV sensor? (select as many as apply)How willing are you to continue using the UV sensor Extremely willing and the UV Guard app as part of research?How willing are you to continue using the UV sensor Extremely willing and the UV Guard app personally?

back_matter.text: Please complete the survey below.Thank you! Yesterday you picked as a goal:Yes No "Apply sunscreen to all of the areas of my body that may be exposed to the sun" Did you shift the time you went outside to periods with less intense UV exposure? For example, did you go outside early in the morning or late in the afternoon?
Did you change how much time you spent outside based on your observed UV exposure as seen on the graph presented on your phone?
Did you change your use of sun protection based on your observed UV exposure as seen on the graph presented on your phone?
How did you change your use of sun protection?
